app.title: AI Enlarger: for Photo & Anime
app.description:
Transform your photos and anime pictures effortlessly with AI Enlarger. Upscale your images by 200%, 400%, or 800% without losing quality. Repair pixelated or blurry photos and enhance resolution seamlessly.

Using advanced AI photo super-resolution technology, AI Enlarger allows you to enlarge images, photos, and anime pictures without blurring or damaging the quality. Easily convert your pictures, cartoons, and animations into 4k, 8k, or even 16k ultra-high-definition wallpapers.

**** Key Features:
1. User-Friendly: Simply upload a picture, and let AI Enlarger handle the rest automatically.
2. Powerful Upscaling: Enlarge photos by 2x, 4x, or 8x to create stunning 4k, 8k, or even 16k HD images.
3. Noise Reduction: Maintain image clarity with advanced noise reduction algorithms.
4. Anime Upscaling: Specially optimized for anime and cartoon images, delivering better quality than Waifu2x and Yome2x.
5. Smart Color Enhancement: Improve color and contrast with AI technology.
6. Fix Blurry Photos: Enhance image clarity and resolution with AI sharpening.
7. Repair Blurry Faces: Use AI to repair and enhance blurry faces, converting low-definition photos to high-definition.

**** How to Use AI Enlarger:
1. Select the photo or image you want to enhance.
2. Upload it and receive a task ID.
3. Wait or Close the app.
4. Check the task ID. Once it shows "success," preview or download your enhanced photo.

**** Subscription Plans:
Upgrade to Pro for unlimited access with our flexible subscription plans:

Monthly Plan: $4.99
Yearly Plan: $16.99

**** Benefits of Pro Subscription:
Access the recent 10 task IDs
Upscale images by 200%, 400%, and 800%
Ad-free experience
Unlimited access

**** Privacy Protection:
All uploaded and processed photos are removed every 24 hours to ensure your privacy.

**** Contact Us

Have questions? Please contact support@imglarger.com
Privacy Policy: https://imglarger.com/blog/privacy-policy/
Terms of use: https://imglarger.com/blog/terms/

app.summary: AI Photo Upscaler & Enhancer & Fix blurry & Improve Photo Quality & Clear Photo

reviews.text: Used to be free to use, now it only gives you 10 pictures to upscale for free. Seriously? I would've been okay with the ads, but this is ridiculous. I don't plan to use the app again, so keep your dang 9 remaining "trials", there's surely a less scummy AI upscaler out there now. It never worked that well to begin with anyway, this wouldn't be worth a subscription. And it's worthless with a limited amount of uses. Don't bother with this app, look elsewhere.

Inconsistent. I just used this app to upscale an image, and it worked great! The image looked cleaner, the coloring was a bit off, but overall I'm very impressed by the work. But then, come my second image. It was about the same resolution, and probably a simple image, but it doesn't change anything. Only the first one got an improvement, the other ones didn't improve at all. So, I'm wondering why it didn't upscale my other images properly.
reviews.replyText: Hi, dear Laurette. Feel so sorry about that and thank you for using AI Image Enlarger to upscale small images. We have tested several times after reading your review, everything is working fine. Would you please try again or send the sample images for us so we can have test from our side? Here is our email address: support@imglarger.com

reviews.text: This app used to be phenomenal, but clearly either an outside party purchased the rights to the app, or a bean counter was brought on the team, and put everything behind a paywall. It's a crying shame, because I swore by this app, it was great. It worked, there were no "trial limits", and it actually ran faster (how did it get slower slower???) I watched this app go from tiny and barely working, to a FANTASTIC app, and finally to wasted space on my homescreen - Such a shame.

You know there is no file picker (other than app's own, which is too slow, perhaps not working at all with my phone with 1000s of photos). I already uninstalled your app and use web-version instead. No file picker..They show only black thumbnails. can't even see my pictures.. it takes eternity to load my own image-thumbnails.. and there is no another file-picker..
reviews.replyText: Hello my friend. Would you please share a screenshot with me? I would like to have a look at it.

reviews.text: I'm not happy at all, I lost my lifetime pro membership, and now I can't get it back even though I'm using the same Google account. Plus, the same annoying issue that I specified before is still there. I'm not happy with ya app dev or devs, I'm sorry if this gets in the negative reviews, but you really should listen to everyone who's trying to help give ideas. I dont know how hard it is to make apps, and I dont know a thing of coding, but adding alphabetical sorting shouldn't be that hard.

This app is amazing! It has recently been updated too so the interface is a lot more modern and aesthetically pleasing. I buy a lot of photo gifts as they are nice memory keepsakes so I use this app a lot to enhance the photo quality. The results are amazing! Some photos taken on your mobile or older photos that are off lesser quality turn out fantastic with the help of this app. I also need to commend the support you get from the app developer! It is second to none! Keep up the great work! üëç

This app enlarges my art beautifully, without any noticeable loss in quality. Does a better job than any other tool I've teied. Only problem is, the max sizing is capped at 8000px, so I can't resize at x8 despite paying for Pro. However, one of my images today DID resize x8 to nearly 16000px, but it only happened once and since then it's gone back to the previous cap. I did email support but never heard back. If I hear back I'll add a star to my rating, and another star if cap is lifted üôÇ

Does what it says, with no ads even for the free version, and the upscaled image looks great. Dunno why other people are having problems, but it worked perfectly for me. The only issue I've had is that with the pro version it seems like up scaling an image 2x twice seems to have a better result than upscaling the same image 4x once.
reviews.replyText: Thanks a lot for using our app. We will improve it as much as we could.

reviews.text: Recently degraded quality, JPG thumbnail only. --- Previous Review: Almost perfect results, almost instantly. Does eyelashes and eyebrows very well, hair not quite as good; other fine details are enlarged (created from mushy JPG) with wonderful results. Odd UI, says "processing" but it's finished - unless you are 'rate limited' (after doing 4 photos), then it insists that you wait a minute and despite showing "processing" seems to only take 2-3 seconds (instead of 1 or 2).

The recent change has been utterly pathetic. Now I have to basically pay to keep using the service once I've used up all my credits or whatever you call them, what a joke. I used to really like using the app, it's basically turned into a joke at this point.

app.AIReview:
AI Enlarger: for Photo & Anime ‚Äì A Comprehensive Review

Overview

AI Enlarger presents itself as a straightforward solution to a common problem faced by mobile photographers and anime enthusiasts alike: low-resolution images. The app promises effortless image enlargement using artificial intelligence, aiming to transform grainy photos and pixelated artwork into high-quality visuals suitable for wallpapers or detailed viewing. With over 1 million installs and a solid 4.39 rating, it‚Äôs clear that many users find value in this tool. However, the core premise of AI-powered image upscaling is still relatively nascent within mobile applications, and AI Enlarger needs to deliver consistently on its ambitious claims. This review delves into all aspects of the app, evaluating its features, performance, user experience, and ultimately, whether it represents a worthwhile investment for users seeking improved photo quality.

Key Features

AI Enlarger boasts a suite of features designed around its core purpose: image enlargement and enhancement. The key elements include:

  • AI Super-Resolution Upscaling: This is the app‚Äôs flagship feature ‚Äì utilizing AI to increase image resolution by 200%, 400%, or 800% without significant quality degradation. The app claims to minimize blurriness often associated with traditional upscaling methods.
  • Pixel Repair & Blur Removal: Beyond simple enlargement, the app includes a dedicated tool for repairing pixelated images and reducing blur. This is crucial for rescuing older photos or low-quality digital scans.
  • Resolution Conversion (4K, 8K, 16K): Users can convert their enlarged images into various ultra-high-definition resolutions, making them ideal for creating large desktop wallpapers or sharing high-resolution content online.
  • Batch Processing: The ability to process multiple images at once streamlines the workflow for users with numerous low-quality photos requiring enhancement. (Note: Batch processing functionality appears to be limited based on user reports).
  • Simple Interface: The app‚Äôs interface is designed to be intuitive, allowing users to quickly select an image and choose their desired enlargement level.

Strengths

Several aspects of AI Enlarger contribute to its popularity.

  • Ease of Use: The app's user interface is genuinely straightforward. Selecting an image and choosing the upscale percentage is a simple process, even for users unfamiliar with photo editing software.
  • Effective Upscaling (In Some Cases): In certain scenarios ‚Äì particularly with relatively clean images that aren‚Äôt excessively damaged or low-resolution to begin with ‚Äì the AI upscaling does deliver noticeable improvements in detail and sharpness. The 200% enlargement often yields a surprisingly clear result, surpassing what many users might expect from basic image editing apps.
  • Significant Install Base: The high number of installs (1,080,539) suggests that the app is effectively meeting the needs of a sizable user base ‚Äì indicating that the core functionality works for a significant portion of its audience.
  • Free to Use: The app‚Äôs free accessibility removes any financial barrier to entry, allowing users to experiment with AI image enhancement without risk.

Areas for Improvement

Despite its strengths, AI Enlarger has notable shortcomings.

  • Inconsistent Results: The most significant issue is the inconsistent quality of the upscaling results. Images with heavy noise, compression artifacts, or severe pixelation often produce blurry and distorted outputs, even at lower enlargement percentages. The "AI" element doesn't always translate to a flawless process.
  • Limited Control: Users have very limited control over the AI‚Äôs processing parameters. There are no options for adjusting sharpening levels, denoising algorithms, or other settings that could fine-tune the upscaling process.
  • Processing Time: Upscaling large images can be surprisingly slow, particularly on lower-end devices. The app relies heavily on CPU processing, and this becomes a bottleneck.
  • Lack of Preview: There‚Äôs no real-time preview function before applying the upscale. Users are essentially blind, relying solely on the final output, which can lead to unexpected results and wasted time.
  • Reliance on Cloud Processing (Potential): While not explicitly stated, the app's performance suggests it might be utilizing cloud processing for some of the AI operations, potentially impacting privacy concerns and requiring a stable internet connection.

User Experience

The user experience is generally positive for basic tasks ‚Äì selecting an image and choosing an enlargement percentage. However, the lack of preview functionality and the sometimes-unpredictable results can lead to frustration. The app‚Äôs interface feels somewhat dated, lacking modern design flourishes. The absence of tutorials or helpful tips adds to the learning curve for new users who may not immediately grasp how to best utilize the AI features.

Value for Money

As a free application, AI Enlarger provides considerable value for casual users experimenting with image enhancement. However, its inconsistent performance limits its usefulness for professional photographers or those requiring consistently high-quality results. Considering the limitations of the AI upscaling algorithm and the lack of advanced controls, the app's price point ‚Äì free ‚Äì is justifiable as a basic tool. Premium versions offering enhanced features and more control would likely be significantly more valuable if the core functionality were consistently reliable.

Conclusion

AI Enlarger represents an intriguing foray into mobile AI-powered image enhancement. It delivers on some of its promises, particularly with relatively clean images undergoing modest enlargement. However, its inconsistent results and limited user controls prevent it from being a truly exceptional tool. While the free price point makes it accessible to anyone needing a quick solution for basic image resizing, users should temper their expectations regarding quality and consistency. The app‚Äôs popularity indicates a demand for this type of functionality, but AI Enlarger needs significant improvements in its AI algorithm and user controls to justify a more dedicated following. A version 2.0 that addresses these shortcomings would undoubtedly elevate the app's value proposition considerably.
